preqs: ((One of FIT1040, ECE2071, FIT1002) and FIT1029) or FIT1045Students beginning FIT1008 are assumed to be able to: Identify the main components of an algorithm (variables, operators, expressions, etc), and write the algorithm associated to the specification of a simple problem. Be able to translate a simple algorithm into a program containing variable declarations, selection, repetition, and lists and/or arrays.

rules.ruleString: (Must have passed an (I/W) unit in {ECE2071, FIT1002, FIT1040} AND  Must have passed 1 (I/W) units in {FIT1029} with grades other than {STANDARD-DEF, STANDARD-NS})
Incompatible with achievement in (I/W) {CSC1030, CSE1303, FIT1015, FIT2085}

((Must have passed an (I/W) unit in {ECE2071, FIT1002, FIT1040} AND  Must have passed 1 (I/W) units in {FIT1029}) or  Must have passed 1 (I/W) units in {FIT1045} with grades other than {STANDARD-DEF, STANDARD-NS})
Incompatible with achievement in (I/W) {CSC1030, CSE1303, FIT1015}

description: This unit introduces students to core problem-solving, analytical skills, and methodologies useful for developing flexible, robust, and maintainable software. In doing this it covers a range of conceptual levels, from high-level algorithms and data-structures, down to the machine models and simple assembly language programming. Topics include data types; data structures; algorithms; algorithmic complexity; recursion; and translation to assembly language.
